string.text: This specific backpack - a military surplus one that's rugged and waterproof, normally comes with the most common and popular stalker suit. You can take it off and use it to make a secret stash in a secluded place.
An over-the-counter sleep aid. If taken, it'll induce drowsiness quickly.
A regular Dream brand cigarette. Smoking is bad for you, but it'll help take the edge off and calm you down.

A removeable battery for PDAs (and other compatiable devices) that can be recharged. You can use it to increase your PDAs power charge, and to find out what the current charge of your PDA is. The most common flashlight used in the Zone does not accept this type of battery.
A detector for measuring anomalous activity. To make measurements you need to take the device in your hands and activate it near the source of anomalous energy.
A plastic bottle filled with cool and refreshing drinking water, great for quenching thirst. These are normally imported into the Zone by traders who buy them in bulk.
A rat that's been cooked with fire. Its much more nutritious than a uncooked rat, and the heat from the fire has sterilized it, making it safe to eat.
A crow that's been cooked with fire. Its much more nutritious than a uncooked crow, and the heat from the fire has sterilized it, making it safe to eat.

This drug relieves the effects of various kinds of psionic radiation. It surpasses other benzodiazepine and abenzodiazepine tranquilizers in terms of how strong it is; it has a very strong anxiolytic (anti-anxiety) and tranquilizing effect; it also has a pronounced anticonvulsant, myorelaxant (muscle relaxant) and sedative effect.
A pill blister pack with a single dose of Chloroquine in it. Chloroquine gives protection against rabies. Most dogs in the Zone are infected with rabies, and will spread it if they attack anyone.
This servo power cell is meant for exoskeletons. In order to supply an exoskeleton with power, you must attach this power cell to your belt.

This suit was made by the stalker who gives by the name 'Golmar'. It has various particles from artifacts embedded in its fabric, giving it useful anomalous properties. Pieces from an gravity artifact have been sewn into this suit's flaps, allowing its user to hover slightly above the ground, increasing height its user can jump, and potentially softening the impact from long falls. This suit also increases its user's carrying capacity by an additional 20 kilograms.
A polyethylene file that contains numerous documents.

Protective suit. Weight: 18kg. Details: Protects the body from Jelly, Burnt Fuzz, most anomalies and physical damage. The torso and back are protected by built-in bio-metallic plates. The suit is equipped with an airtight, reinforced plastic helmet and two oxygen bottles. Note: During extended periods of use the suit tears through and gradually deteriorates beyond use.

Protective suit. Weight: 8 kg. Details: Protects the body from weak anomalies and physical damage. Equipped with an oxygen mask. Note: During extended periods of use the suit tears through and gradually deteriorates beyond use.

Protective suit. Weight: 12 kg. Details: Protects the user from Jelly, Burnt Fuzz, many anomalies and physical damage. Equipped with an airtight helmet and an oxygen bottle. Note: During extended periods of use the suit tears through and gradually deteriorates beyond use.

An "EXP-4" scientific protective suit with an airtight red helmet. Weighs 11 kg. It protects the body from fire, acid gases, a variety of anomalies (including "Burnt Fuzz"), and mechanical damage. Equipped with two oxygen cylinders. Warning: with continuous use it will become damaged and torn.
Army binoculars with adjustable (up to 7.5 diopters) magnification.

A device that detects the presence of anomalous formations, along with hot pockets of radiation. The distance to the anomaly is indicated by the how frequently the light emits. To ensure reliability, readings should be done when stationary.\nMaxinum number of anomalies that can be detected and registered simultaneously - 4.\nDetection radius - 10 meters.

An outdated, first-generation anomaly detector. It emits a light when it detects anomalies. The distance to the anomaly is indicated by the how frequently the light emits. To ensure reliability, readings should be done when stationary.
- does not detect all anomalies
- can give false or inaccurate readings
- If you have this device, you can scan items in your backpack for radiation.

A device that detects the presence of anomalous formations. The distance to the anomaly is indicated by the how frequently the light emits. To ensure reliability, readings should be done when stationary.\nMaxinum number of anomalies that can be detected and registered simultaneously - 3.\nDetection radius - 10 meters.
A PDA is an indispensable device in the Zone for any stalker, useful for things such as cataloging data or maintaining a journal.
A flashlight that has a fairly powerful bulb. Quite useful at nighttime or in areas with little or no lighting.
An opioid-based medication used to treat pain, used by many stalkers in the Zone as a quick fix.

No bakers have ever been identified in the Zone - so it's safe to assume that this bread comes from the Big Land, but it's neither contaminated nor radioactive, being fresh and quite edible. At least no complaints have been reported thus far.

Presumably, these canned rations were looted by stalkers from an army ration depot. Without any kind of label on the can, it's hard to say for sure. Should still be good to eat, if you believe the best before date.
For better or worse, this sausage - a mix of chicken and a soy substitute - is often a stalker's breakfast, lunch and dinner in one. Can be stored for a long time due to high preservative content.

Vodka made by GSC. Goes down easy and considerably lowers the effects of radiation. Should be enjoyed in moderation.
Loss of coordination.
Slightly relieves the effects of radiation sickness.
Quenches thirst.

Perfectly filters out radionuclides from the body and reduces the impact of absorbed radiation. There's also a supplied bar of hematogen in a separate packet.\nPossible loss of coordination.\Provides treatment for radiation sickness.

A normal elastic bandage used to stop bleeding and prevent infection of wounds. For regular bleeding, carefully apply the bandage to the wound. For arterial bleeding, urgently tie the bandage around the affected area.
A general purpose single-use medical kit. Handy for treating various injuries - wounds, bruises, regular and chemical burns and various types of poisoning. In demand among stalkers.
This detector is designed to detect anomalous formations, as well as hot spots of radioactive contamination.
A regular six-string guitar. Stalkers enjoy playing a tune while sitting around a campfire.
A regular harmonica, the simplest musical instrument in the Zone.
